meanings.definition: A substance that increases the acidity of a solution.
meanings.sent1: The acidifier made the lemonade taste sour.
meanings.sent2: The vinegar acted as an acidifier in the salad dressing.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous chef added too much acidifier to the recipe, creating a tangy surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like an acidifier, slowly eroding his confidence.
meanings.sent5: The acidifier turned the blue litmus paper red, demonstrating its acidic nature.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that acidifies.
meanings.sent1: The lab technician was the designated acidifier in the experiment.
meanings.sent2: The battery can be considered an acidifier due to its corrosive properties.
meanings.sent3: The little girl playfully pretended to be an acidifier, claiming she could turn everything sour with a touch.
meanings.sent4: His criticism acted as an acidifier, slowly eating away at her self-esteem.
meanings.sent5: The acidifier in the group, always quick to point out flaws, was not the most popular member.
